item.title: Build Your Own Private Cloud Storage
item.description: Lots of small and midsize businesses are using cloud storage, particularly for disaster recovery. However, local storage is still necessary. While Storage Attached Networks (SANs) are a common solution, they’re expensive and complex. A simpler option exists. Introducing Drobo, an advanced hard disk storage solution that’s surprisingly easy to use. It works with standard 3.5" SATA drives of any capacity, resembling a straightforward multi-bay drive enclosure. Adding or removing drives, even swapping a 1 TB for a 2 TB, is always possible.

item.title: Fiber Optic Bandwidth For Remote Backup
item.description: Businesses need to have a solid plan to safeguard their important data. While basic backups on disks or tapes can help with minor issues like a crashed computer, they are inadequate for major events like natural disasters. Offsite backup is crucial in these situations. The key is choosing a location geographically distant from your primary site to avoid shared risks. Backing up data across regional offices, separated by significant distances, enhances data protection.
